head.supplied: Chief Secretary's Office ¶ Melbourne ¶ 9. July ¶ 187 ¶ 4 ¶ Sir, ¶ I have the honor, by direction of the Chief Secretary, to request that you will be good enough to cause this Department to be furnis...

div.p: No. 4979, pp. 629, 630, unit 37, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Circular letter sent, with the name of the appropriate department inserted, to 9 Ministers and 16 heads of subsidiary departments within the Chief Secretary’s Department.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: I have the honor, by direction of the Chief Secretary, to request that you will be good enough to cause this Department to be furnished, at as early a date as possible, with the undermentioned information, for the purpose of being laid before the Legislative Council in compliance with an Order on the motion of the Honble. W. A. C. A'Beckett M.L.C.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
p.seg: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: A Return of the names of all persons employed as supernumeraries and non-classified clerks in the Government Botanist Department shewing salaries, date of appointment and office in which they are employed.

The Government Botanist
For reply see M. to J. Francis, July 1874 (in this edition as 74-07-00c).
